title.english: The Disastrous Life of Saiki K.

description:
To the average person, psychic abilities might seem a blessing; for Kusuo Saiki, however, this couldn't be further from the truth. Gifted with a wide assortment of supernatural abilities ranging from telepathy to x-ray vision, he finds this so-called blessing to be nothing but a curse. As all the inconveniences his powers cause constantly pile up, all Kusuo aims for is an ordinary, hassle-free life—a life where ignorance is bliss.

Unfortunately, the life of a psychic is far from quiet. Though Kusuo tries to stay out of the spotlight by keeping his powers a secret from his classmates, he ends up inadvertently attracting the attention of many odd characters, such as the empty-headed Riki Nendou and the delusional Shun Kaidou. Forced to deal with the craziness of the people around him, Kusuo comes to learn that the ordinary life he has been striving for is a lot more difficult to achieve than expected.

Note: Aired in 2 versions, a 120-episode 5-minute short series, and a combined 24-episode 24-minute TV series with the same content.
synonyms: Η Καταστροφική Ζωή του Σάικι Κ

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Asexual
tags.description: Features a character who isn't sexually attracted to people of any sex or gender.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Aromantic
tags.description: Features a character who experiences little to no romantic attraction.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

name.native: ゾルベ・勘解由小路・シャーベライト

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shu1aso)

He is married to [Dempagumi.inc](https://anilist.co/staff/155222) idol Mirin Furukawa.
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

Takuma Suzuki is an episode director. 

Not to be confused with the [voice actor](https://anilist.co/staff/101981) of the same name.

[Website](https://dempagumi.tokyo/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dempagumi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dempagumi.official/) | [Facebook](https://ja-jp.facebook.com/dempagumi.inc/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/dempagumiinc) | [LINE LIVE](https://live.line.me/channels/265) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dempagumi.inc) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/でんぱ組.inc)

Dempagumi.inc is a Japanese idol group. They belong to “DEARSTAGE” and are active in various fields. All the members are originally hard core geeks / otaku of anime, manga, games, fashion, art, etc. and they each pursue their own hobbies! They belong to a new record label, MEME TOKYO, produced by TOY’S FACTORY. They introduced new members Rin Kaname and Nagi Nemoto, on December 30th 2017.

__Members:__
• Mirin-chan - __Mirin Furukawa__ (古川未鈴) born September 19th in Kagawa prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/FurukawaMirin) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/furukawamirin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCO7Hr02PJtVjzVTl1X-MmEA) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/furukawamirin)
• Risachii - __Risa Aizawa__ (相沢梨紗) born August 2nd in Osaka Prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/RISA_memesama) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/risacheeese) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7uGtrz1dYludhU1VCkQGRg)
• Eitaso - __Eimi Naruse__ (成瀬瑛美) born February 16th in Fukushima prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/eitaso) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/eimisunshine) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUZD1m9TozXJR0YLI3trPhw)
• Pinky! - __Ayane Fujisaki__ (藤咲彩音) born December 7th in Saitama prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/PINKY_neko) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/pinky_ayane) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGWWUlpP5u4WBvUf5wmbxKw)
• Perorin - __Rin Kaname__ (鹿目凛) born September 21st in Saitama prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/peroperorinko01) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/kaname_rin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7S0hgqh_7uZadf_shmOruQ)
• Nemo - __Nagi Nemoto__ (根本凪) born March 15th in Ibaraki Prefecture, Japan. - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nemoto_nagi) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nemonagi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxDX9DXSqoRxxB-NO5Hz6XQ)

__Former Members:__
• Akari Owata (小和田あかり)
• Miu Atobe (跡部みぅ)
• [Moga Mogami](https://anilist.co/staff/155223) (最上もが)
• Nemu Yumemi (夢眠ねむ)

[Website](http://psychiclover.net)

Psychic Lover (サイキックラバー) is a J-pop band consisting of vocalist YOFFY (Yoshiyuki Wada / 和田よしゆき) and guitarist [IMAJO](https://anilist.co/staff/357213) (Tatsuhiro Imajo / 今城龍寛). Originally consisting of six members, YOFFY and IMAJO are the only two who remained for their rise to fame. Much of their work has been featured as opening and closing themes of Japanese television series and anime. YOFFY has also worked with Eizo Sakamoto (vocalist of [Anthem](https://anilist.co/staff/191547/) and Animetal), [Masaaki Endou](https://anilist.co/staff/101528/), [Sakura Nogawa](https://anilist.co/staff/95204/), [Ai Tokunaga](https://anilist.co/staff/95324), [Ryouko Shintani](https://anilist.co/staff/95315/), [Mayumi Gojou](https://anilist.co/staff/107007/), [Sister MAYO](https://anilist.co/staff/345387/), and [Yukari Fukui](https://anilist.co/staff/95359/) on other projects.

__Height:__ 173 cm
__Hobbies:__ Karaoke, gaming
__Agency:__ Across Entertainment

[Profile](http://across-ent.com/talent/men/natsuki_hanae.html) | [Website](https://columbia.jp/hanaenatsuki/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hanae0626) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3C3YOGFjn7Pq3lOCeUFHfg) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/hanae0626/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hanae_natsuki0626/)

Won Best Rookie at the 9th Seiyuu Awards (2015) for his role as Inaho Kaizuka in _Aldnoah.Zero_. Won Best Lead Actor at the 14th Seiyuu Awards (2020) for his role as Tanjiro Kamado in _Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba_.

He is married, is a father of twin daughters, and has a cat named [Konpei](https://anilist.co/staff/269430/Konpei).

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Protagonist - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Ling Yang - Wuthering Waves (VG)

**Height:** 153 cm (5'0)

__[Profile (Osawa)](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/kayanoai/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kayanoai_0913) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kayanoai_0913/) | [YouTube Channel Official Twitter](https://twitter.com/_kayanomi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0D6qi-Gr5RW7hqOvTEKmAw)__

__Introduction:__
Ai Kayano is a Japanese voice actress and vocalist currently affiliated with Office Osawa.

__Biography:__
Kayano wanted to work in a job that would involve "healing people", leading to initially take up a course at a vocational school. She worked in the beauty industry and became interested in acting after having seen [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477/). While attending school, Kayano continued working in the industry and paid for her tuition.

Kayano began working at Pro-Fit in 2010, voicing two supporting characters in the original video animation [Princess Resurrection](https://anilist.co/anime/9159/). In 2011, she voiced [Meiko "Menma" Honma](https://anilist.co/character/40592/) in [Anohana](https://anilist.co/anime/9989/) and received the Best Rookie Actress award for said role at the 6th Seiyuu Awards. Kayano, [Haruka Tomatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/95890/) and [Saori Hayami](https://anilist.co/staff/95869/) performed the series' ending theme "Secret Base – Kimi ga Kureta Mono (10 years after Ver.)", a cover of a song originally sung by the band Zone.

She is often praised for her vocal range, having voiced a variety of characters such as [Mayaka Ibara](https://anilist.co/character/55137/), [Mashiro Shiina](https://anilist.co/character/61371/), [Darkness](https://anilist.co/character/89363/) and [Akari Kawamoto](https://anilist.co/character/24311/) for example, none of which one would connect to the same voice actress.

**Trivia:**
- Worked part-time at a coffee shop with [Chinatsu Akasaki](https://anilist.co/staff/107652/) before becoming a voice actress.
- She got around 100 suggestions for her nickname in the Anohana radio show, from which she herself picked out Kayanon.

Non-anime roles:
- Atago - Azur Lane
- Graf Zeppelin - Azur Lane
- Kaga - Azur Lane
- Renown - Azur Lane
- Y'shtola Rhul - Final Fantasy XIV

**Height:** 174 cm  

[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/nobunagashimazaki/) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/nobunaga_s) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nobunaga_s/)

Non-Anime Roles:
~!Kaedehara Kazuha - Genshin Impact (Video Game)
Silver - Twisted Wonderland (Video Game)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YooheySuzuki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鈴木洋平_(アニメ演出家))

Youhei Suzuki is a director and former director of photography formerly working for [J.C.Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/JC-Staff). Currently freelance.

Not to be confused with the producer of the same name Youhei Suzuki (鈴木洋平).
